entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Settlement Self-Government Panel Survey in Hungary 1995-2002
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E64: TÁRKI Settlement Self-Government Panel Survey in Hungary 1995-2002. data sheet. Version: 2009-04-09
entry.dcterms:creator: Sik, Endre
entry.dcterms:subject: 2004-03-00: the labels of the data file are corrected and complemented
entry.dcterms:description: black work, black economy, human market, "kgst" market on the settlements, opinions about immigrants, refugees, their admission, xenophobia, anti-Roma sentiments, inter-ethnic conflicts in the settlement, the econimic management of the self-government, its inflation expectations, its economic situation, the living standard of the population, social aid, relations with parties, civil organizations, nation-wide associations
entry.dcterms:subject: minorities
migration
political institutions, public administration
demography
economic conditions and indicators
social welfare policy and systems
labour and employment
administrative area
survey data
panel

All of the Hungarian settlements having a self-government were sent a questionnaire, in the individual waves the response rate was different (on the average 25-35%). The questionnaires were completed by mayors (in 2001 spring mayors and notaries) or persons appointed by them.
Posted self-administered questionnaires.
B
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
